Package BackEnd

Class Word

  • java.lang.Object
    • BackEnd.Word
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Word>
    public class Word
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Word>
    This class holds all information and methods for the word objects. It is used as a blueprint for importing the Json.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ollie

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Word​(java.lang.String ew, java.lang.String ww, java.lang.String wt)
      This constructor is used to create word objects during the application.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Word

        public Word​(java.lang.String ew,
            java.lang.String ww,
            java.lang.String wt)
        This constructor is used to create word objects during the application. It isn't used by the Gson method.
        Parameters:
        ew - becomes english
        ww - becomes welsh
        wt - becomes wordType

    • Method Detail

      • getDictType

        public static char getDictType()
        Method to get the dictionary mode. It is static, so applies to all Words
        Returns:
        type of dictionary (i.e english or welsh)

      • setDictType

        public static void setDictType​(char dictType)
        Parameters:
        dictType - becomes the mode for all Words Method to set the dictionary mode. It is static, so applies to all Words

      • getEnglish

        public java.lang.String getEnglish()
        Method to get the english word from the definition pair. If it is a verb, the word is preceded with 'to '.
        Returns:
        the english word

      • getWelsh

        public java.lang.String getWelsh()
        Method to get the welsh word from the definition pair.
        Returns:
        the welsh word

      • getWordType

        public java.lang.String getWordType()
        Method to get the wordType word from the definition.
        Returns:
        the wordType

      • isTranslation

        public boolean isTranslation​(java.lang.String englishWord,
                             java.lang.String welshWord)
        Method to check whether the inputs are translations of each other.
        Parameters:
        englishWord - checked against this.english
        welshWord - checked against this.welsh
        Returns:
        a boolean - whether or not the two words are a translation of one another

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
        The equals method checks if two words are the same, it is used during the search algorithm.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - is cast to type Word and check to see if it is the same as this.
        Returns:
        a boolean depending on whether the two objects are equal.

      • englishContains

        public boolean englishContains​(java.lang.String s)
        This method brings in the filter from the search bar and compares it with the start of the english word.
        Parameters:
        s - is the filter
        Returns:
        true - if the starts are the same | false - if they are not

      • welshContains

        public boolean welshContains​(java.lang.String s)
        This method brings in the filter from the search bar and compares it with the start of the welsh word.
        Parameters:
        s - is the filter
        Returns:
        true - if the starts are the same | false - if they are not

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(Word o)
        This method is used by the Collections.sort method. It compares the objects by english word in english mode and by the welsh word if in welsh mode. This method ignores the case of the words, so words with capitals at the beginning are placed with uncapitalised words.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Word>
        Parameters:
        o - is the Word object to compare this to
        Returns:
        an integer that is positive if the word is 'larger' or negative if the word is 'smaller' or 0 if they are the same.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method returns the information from Word in a readable format. It is used by the ListView object in the GUI. In English mode, the english is first, and vice versa.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a readable string with the information from Word
